title: How can fascination help in overcoming fear and anxiety?
first_phrase: The last 200 tokens of this text explore the concept of fascination as a tool for self-reorganization and healing. The author introduces the technique of Trataka, used in Eastern practices to focus the mind and engender a mental void, before delving into the role of fear and anxiety in creating negative fascination. They discuss two methods for intervention: the therapy of the look, which chases away negative fascination through positive fascination, and the direct contact method, which tackles symptoms directly. Lastly, the author offers a quantum view of the healing process, as exemplified by the work of Erminio Di Pisa.
content: It has been noticed by some people that, given the excessive closeness of the point thus fixed, adjustment generally proves insufficient to enable a clear vision, notwithstanding the contraction. The surrounding objects end up occupying only the peripheral part of the retina, due to the central part of the retina being already occupied. Peripheral sensations are weaker than those that are felt at the centre. In those conditions, the subject turns almost blind to the outside world, and the more the internal deflection of the eyes is increased, the more the process gains effectiveness. The void One might be tempted to ask why so much effort should be put on casting the outside objects out of one’s focus. It is however possible to detect a useful aspect in that endeavour. It paralyzes one’s will. It also paralyzes the attention which, if it happens to settle on one object only, is inclined to forget the others. Through the assistance of ocular concentration, the yogi is not just able to remove the vision of external objects, but also to empty his thoughts, whereupon it becomes easy for him to meditate in the void. In an analogous manner, when fascination is resorted to, the subject enters a state of void where an automatic rebalancing might occur, and where one can rid himself of limiting thoughts. The process is as mental as it is physical, so much so that one can fascinate even while he is standing quite far from a person. A quantum view And finally a quantum view of the healing process of Prof. Erminio Di Pisa.
last_phrase: In conclusion, these exercises aim at achieving a state of calm and emotional control through physical and mental training. From de-congesting emotions to gaining control over one's nerves and mind, these techniques can help individuals achieve a magnetic look, positive speaking, and ultimately enter a meditative state of void. With daily practice and dedication, one can attain greater levels of focus and emotional mastery, leading to a more fulfilling and productive life.
